definition: to start a rumor
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
popular ballad/rumor
to start rumours and create trouble

sentences.english: Their whole political life has been about a rough and tumble campaign, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 他們的整個政治生活中一直面臨着種種造謠中傷。
媒體的造謠變得制度化了。

sentences.english: In the court, he thought the charges were slanderous rumours.
sentences.chinese: 在法庭上，他認爲對他的指控是造謠中傷。

sentences.english: But she thinks it's keen that readers are so creative in their rumormongering .
sentences.chinese: 不過她認爲讀者們的造謠能力如此之強真是很刺激。

sentences.english: Then, the onus is on the rumormonger to explain themselves.
sentences.chinese: 於是造謠者就有義務爲自己辯解。

sentences.english: She slandered him behind his back.
sentences.chinese: 她在背地裏對他造謠中傷。

sentences.english: For barefaced lying you are really it.
sentences.chinese: 就無恥造謠之本事而論，你真算得上天下第一。

sentences.english: To start a rumour for me might not hurl away on my election.
sentences.chinese: 在選舉過程中，造謠中傷恐怕還阻止不了我的當選。

sentences.english: Somebody has been cooking up a story out of spite and telling it to the old man .
sentences.chinese: 有人存心造謠，編了一個故事，跑去告訴老人。

sentences.english: She deals in gossip and slander.
sentences.chinese: 她常搬弄是非和造謠中傷。

sentences.english: China's Sina Weibo is the world's best rumor-mongering machine ever.
sentences.chinese: 中國的新浪微博是世界上最好的造謠機器。

sentences.english: You surely won't print (ie publish, esp in a newspaper) such a scandalous allegation.
sentences.chinese: 你絕不會讓這種造謠中傷的言論披露見報的吧。

sentences.english: You surely won't print (ie publish, esp in a newspaper ) such a scandalous allegation.
sentences.chinese: 你絕不會讓這種造謠中傷的言論披露見報的吧。

sentences.english: Almost immediately the KMT rumor machine slipped into overdrive.
sentences.chinese: 國民黨的造謠部隊幾乎立刻就開始發猋。

sentences.english: Crimes of violence and attacks on the person require more or less pluck .
sentences.chinese: 造謠惑衆和人身攻擊是多多少少需要有一些勇氣的。

sentences.english: Owen stabbed his friend Max in the back by telling lies about him.
sentences.chinese: 歐文背後造謠中傷他的朋友麥克斯。

definition: to criticize (as a matter of principle)
misconception/fallacy
personal attack
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to insult/to revile/abuse/vituperation
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to denounce/to condemn
to quote out of context (idiom)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
complete nonsense (idiom)
to quibble
